Create and save wide and join dataframes

Source: R/preprocess.R
generate_df.Rd

generate_df() creates wide and join dataframes from the long data and metadata. It saves them in the data/processed/data_metadata directory in RDA format.

Usage

generate_df(
  long_data,
  metadata = NULL,
  join = TRUE,
  metadata_cols = c("DAid", "Disease", "Sex", "Age", "BMI"),
  save = TRUE
)

Arguments

long_data

The long data.

metadata

The metadata.

join

If TRUE, the dataframes are joined with metadata.

metadata_cols

The metadata columns to join with data.

save

If TRUE, the dataframes are saved.

Value

A list containing the following elements:

  • wide_data: The wide data.

  • join_data: The joined data with metadata. If join is FALSE, this is not returned.

Details

It will filter out rows with missing values in Disease, as a results of mismatching between data and metadata

Examples

generate_df(example_data, example_metadata, save = FALSE)
#> $wide_data
#> # A tibble: 586 × 101
#>    DAid    AARSD1   ABL1  ACAA1    ACAN    ACE2  ACOX1   ACP5    ACP6  ACTA2
